DESC:
PR: 0079151586 - SOLICITATION ISSUE DATE: 2019 JUNE 25: CLOSING DATE: 2019 JUL 24

This solicitation will result in a Definite Quantity Contract / Firm Fixed Price for the quantity of 68. National Stock Number (NSN) 1560 014877665. Approved source(s):

NORTHROP GRUMMAN SYSTEMS (79U29)

This procurement is Unrestricted, using Other Than Full and Open Competition. Delivery for this procurement is DLA Direct. Production delivery is 222 Days AFAA. Inspection/Acceptance at Origin, FOB at Origin, FDT applies. This is a critical application item. This item has technical data some or all of which is subject to Export-control regulations. Enhanced Joint Certification Program - MANDATORY. Distribution of the technical data and eligibility for award are limited to those suppliers qualified through JCP certification, or to those licensed by either the Departments of State or Commerce; or to Foreign Suppliers pursuant to international Agreements.

Government First Article Preproduction approval required. Testing will be in accordance with applicable drawings, specifications and/or Engineering instructions. The first article offered shall be manufactured at the facilities in which production quantities are procured and produced under this contract. When submitting the first article(s) for government testing, a copy of the contract and all applicable drawings, specifications, engineering instructions, certifications, and inspection sheets shall be provided.


Supplier Performance Risk System (SPRS) applies. Price, Past Performance and Delivery will be equally weighted. The final contract award decision may be based upon a combination of price, past performance, and other evaluation factors as described in the solicitation. This request is for a written proposal. See page 2 of the solicitation for methods of proposal submittal.

This solicitation includes DLAD Procurement Note L09, Reverse Auction. The Reverse Auction will be conducted online and you must register your company at dla.procurexinc.com in order to participate. Suppliers are encouraged to access Procurex to self-register and review the available training to learn how to participate in an auction. Suppliers who do not self-register will be loaded into Procurex by the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) Aviation. If you have any problems with registration, contact the Procurex Help Desk by email at service@procurexinc.com or toll-free at 866-412-7161.

The solicitation issue date is 2019 JUN 25, closing 2019 JUL 24. A copy of the solicitation will be available via the DIBBS Website https://www.dibbs.bsm.dla.mil/ on the issue date cited in the RFP. From the DIBBS Homepage, select Request for Proposal (RFP) / Invitation for Bid (IFB) from the menu under the tab Solicitations. Then search for and choose the RFP you wish to download. RFPs are in portable document format (PDF). To download and view these documents you will need the latest version of Adobe Acrobat Reader. This software is available free at http://www.adobe.com.

Offerors not cited as acceptable sources in the Purchase Order Text are required to obtain Source Approval from The Design Control Activity. SOURCE APPROVAL REQUESTS/TECHNICAL DATA PACKAGES must be submitted to DLA AVIATION with the proposal.

OFFADD: 12211 Science Drive Orlando FL 32826-3224
SUBJECT: Joint Land Component Constructive Training Capability (JLCCTC)
CONTACT: Marvin J. Hagan, Contract Specialist, Phone 4072083349, Email marvin.j.hagan.civ@mail.mil - Dunamis T. Triska, Contracting Officer, Phone 4072085862, Email dunamis.t.triska.civ@mail.mil
DESC:
8 June 2019 Update:

Description:

On behalf of the U.S. Army Program Executive Office for Simulation, Training and Instrumentation (PEO STRI) and the Army Contracting Command (ACC) Orlando is issuing this synopsis IAW the requirement at FAR Subpart 5.2 Synopses of Proposed Contract Actions. The Government intends to award a contract for the Joint Land Component Constructive Training Capability (JLCCTC) program.

The Government intends to issue a Cost Plus Fixed Fee (CPFF), Cost Reimbursable (CR), Cost Plus Incentive Fee (CPIF), and Firm Fixed Price (FFP) Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) service contract. To be awarded to a single offeror using a Best Value/ Trade-off system. The period of performance (PoP) will be 10 years. The U.S. Government's determination is the JLCCTC contract shall be competed under a Single Award IDIQ, Full and Open Competition. The North American Industry Classification System code is 541512. The Product/Service Code is D302. The solicitation for this procurement is W900KK-19-R-0079. The solicitation will be posted to the Federal Business Opportunities website by the end of June 2019/early July 2019. The closing response date will be 45-60 days after posting of the solicitation.

Background:

JLCCTC is the Army's constructive simulation toolkit, supporting Army Title X training worldwide for Army Commanders and their staffs. JLCCTC supports institutional and operational unit training for both Active Component (AC), Reserve Component (RC) and Army National Guard (ARNG) units providing capabilities across the range of warfighting functions. JLCCTC is a software modeling and simulation (M&S) capability that is configurable to any combination of M&S as required by training exercise intent/design. JLCCTC is fielded to about 40 fielding sites worldwide including Mission Training Complexes (MTCs) facilities, Training and Doctrine Command (TRADOC) facilities, and other customer locations as required. As such, this acquisition requires services to be performed worldwide.

Program Requirement:

The Program Executive Office for Simulation, Training, and Instrumentation, has a requirement to procure software development, design, integration, test, fielding, installation, management, documentation, Post Deployment Software Support (PDSS), Pre-Planned Product Improvements (P3I), and delivery of the Joint Land Component Constructive Training Capability.

Draft Solicitation:

A draft solicitation for this contemplated effort was posted to FBO under Pre-solicitation Notice number W900KK-19-R-0079 was posted on 11 December 2018. Please consult the draft solicitation for more details. Note that the draft solicitation is for informational purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation or proposal.

Disclaimer:

This synopsis is published in accordance with FAR Subpart 5.2 and does not constitute a Request for Proposal (RFP) or a commitment by the U.S. Government, nor should it be construed as such. Submission of any information in response to this synopsis is not requested. There shall be no basis for claims against the Government as a result of any information contained in this posting.

Primary Point of Contacts:

Marvin J. Hagan,
Contract Specialist
marvin.j.hagan.civ@mail.mil

Secondary Point of Contact:
Dunamis T. Triska,
Contracting Officer
dunamis.t.triska.civ@mail.mil

********************************************************************************
6 April 2019 Update:

The JLCCTC Recompete team is currently resuming activities. The Government will resume reviewing the Questions/Comments provided to the DRFP. Based on the Questions/Comments and information from Industry, a Pre-Solicitation conference will not be held. The Final RFP will be released late 3rd quarter/early 4th quarter FY 19, approximately around the June/July 2019 timeframe. Questions/Comments from the DRFP will be publish before or with the Final RFP. Please continue to check Fed Biz Opps for JLCCTC Recompete updates.


*******************************************************************************

14 March 2019 Update:

The JLCCTC Recompete acquisition is currently on hold. Once activities resume, the Government will resume reviewing the Questions/Comments provided to the DRFP. Additionally, a determination has not yet been made as to whether a Pre-Solicitation conference will be held. Please continue to check Fed Biz Opps for JLCCTC Recompete updates.

****************************************************************************** 
 
19 December 2018 Update:

A JLCCTC Industry Day was held on 20 March 2018. See Solicitation Number: W900KK-R-18 for additional information. A list of all the JLCCTC Industry Day Attendees (with contact information) has been provided.

******************************************************************************

This posting is to provide a DRAFT Request for Proposal for the Joint Land Component Constructive Training Capability (JLCCTC). This is NOT a request for proposals; therefore, no formal proposals are required or will be accepted. All comments and recommendations shall be submitted via email using the Question/Comment form embedded in Section L Attachment L1- DRFP Questions_Comments. Comments and questions shall ONLY be provided to the Contract Specialists Marvin Hagan at marvin.j.hagan.civ@mail.mil, Dean Halvatzis at dean.m.halvatzis.civ@mail.mil and the Contracting Officer Dunamis Triska at dunamis.t.triska.civ@mail.mil with the full DRAFT solicitation # within the subject line. Responses shall be received no later than 12:00 pm Eastern Standard Time on 18 January 2019. Questions and Comments via phone will NOT be accepted.

******************************************************************************

THIS IS DRAFT SOLICITATION TO OBTAIN COMMENTS AND RECOMMENDATIONS ONLY AND NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS; THEREFORE, NO FORMAL PROPOSALS ARE REQUESTED, REQUIRED OR WILL BE ACCEPTED. OFFERS SHOULD NOT RELY ON THE DRAFT SOLICITATION IN DEVELOPING THEIR
FINAL PROPOSED APPROACH AS THE FINAL SOLICITATION MAY DIFFER FROM THE DRAFT SOLICITATION.

The United States Army Program Executive Office for Simulation, Training and Instrumentation (PEO STRI) has conducted market research regarding its requirement to develop, field, and support JLCCTC, an ACAT II M&S program that contributes to the Army Training Mission Area, by providing the appropriate levels of resolution and fidelity to support unit collective and combined arms training. The target Training Audience (TA) for this capability is the commander and their staff. As the Army's constructive simulation product suite, JLCCTC supports the institutional and operational unit training, for both active component, National Guard and reserve component units, providing the capabilities needed to support the Full Range of Military Operations. These operations include Offensive, Defensive, and Stability/Civil Support. The U.S. Government's determination is the anticipated JLCCTC contract shall be competed under Full and Open Competition.

This is a DRAFT Solicitation and serves as a mechanism for comments and recommendations from industry to be submitted regarding the PEO STRI JLCCTC requirement. The intent of this DRAFT Solicitation is to allow an exchange with industry in the form of questions, comments, suggestions, and corrections regarding perceived unnecessary or inefficient requirements. Potential Offerors should not rely upon the Draft RFP in developing their final proposed approach, because the final RFP is likely to differ from the draft. Potential Offerors are encouraged to comment on all aspects of the DRAFT Solicitation and identify unnecessary or inefficient requirements for the JLCCTC effort that may significantly improve the final solicitation.

A Pre-Solicitation Conference is tentatively set for the second quarter of Fiscal Year 2019. More information will be provided at a later date.

CONTACT: Tina D Cook, Contracting Officer, Phone 406-544-5807, Email tina.cook@fs.fed.us - Cliff Lewis, Engineer, Phone 406-758-5222, Email cliff.lewis@usda.gov
DESC:
This is a Solicitation  Notice for a Request for Quote (RFQ) for the restoration of the Van Lake Campground. The major items of work include: constructing new access road; clearing and grubbing; excavation and camping spur reconstruction; hauling and placing barrier rocks and crushed aggregate surfacing; fabrication and installation of concrete/wood picnic tables and concrete wheel stops; installing Government-furnished fire rings and food storage locker; obliterating 0.39 miles of road; and seeding, fertilizing and mulching the sites.

The Van Lake Campground is located in Missoula County Montana, Swan Lake Ranger District, Flathead National Forest. 33 miles south of Bigfork Montana on highway 83. Township 22 North, Range 17 West, Section 03

The estimated number of work days for this project is 30 days. Work will be performed during the following performance periods: July 15, 2019 through Oct. 1, 2019 and/or June 15, 2020 through Oct, 1, 2020. No work is allowed between the dates of Oct. 2, 2019 through June 14, 2020.

The estimated dollar range for this contract is between $100,000 and $250,000.
POPADDRESS:
Swan Lake Ranger District
200 Ranger Station Rd.
Big Fork, MT
